description: Social work majors study the "how-to" of social work practice, particularly intercultural
communication. They describe strengths and problems of diverse individuals and families; frame
goals and plans for change utilizing the planned change process and the systems perspective; and
use ethical decision-making, informed by the scientific method, grounded in the liberal arts, and
concerned with social justice. Students demonstrate learning in videotaped role playing and have
an agency interviewing experience.  Prerequisites: Social Work 221 and concurrent enrollment in
Social Work 246. Offered annually in the Fall Semester.
